ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Grammar, listening and reading comprehension, as well as many new Kanji characters and words.
I learned Japanese reading, writing, and speaking skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Meeting every day led to consistent engagement with the course.  Filming videos and shadowing exercises for homework assignments helped with practicing my speaking skills. The writing compositions were helpful in practicing my writing skills. I appreciated the opportunity to practice speaking with other students daily in class as well. The amount of daily homework was difficult to manage sometimes particularly the last two weeks of class where we had  2 tests, oral final, and  a speech.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you're committed to studying Japanese, absolutely.

I would. Japanese language courses are very well organized. But this is definitely for students who are willing to plug in hours for daily homework assignments and weekly assessments (every other week for unit exams, the other week for kanji tests). But it's really not that bad as long as you engage in class.
Be warned, there will be a homework assignment 5 days a week and likely one or two quizzes each week.
Yes, I like the Japanese classes at Yale a lot, very well-structured.
Great professor. Pushes you. Good course to take if you want to put in the effort.
If you are interested in learning Japanese and committing the time to do the daily work for the course, I would recommend taking the course.
